entry.title: French Protests Highlight Pressure on European Leaders From Energy Crisis
entry.content: Thousands of people march across France to demand higher wages to cope with rising energy bills and broader inflation, a sign of the political turmoil facing the region’s leaders as the war in Ukraine rages with no end in sight.

entry.title: Russia Destroyed Nearly a Third of Ukraine's Power Stations, Zelensky Says
entry.content: Ukrainian President Volodymyr Zelensky said Russia has destroyed about 30% of the country’s power stations as Moscow tries to sap Ukraine’s will and ability to fight on the battlefield following a month of gains by Kyiv.

entry.title: Fashion Industry Gets Torn by Europe's Soaring Energy Bills
entry.content: The surge in natural-gas and electricity prices has imperiled thousands of small factories and workshops that supply brands such as Gucci and H&M. The cost of gas, said one Italian fabric dyer, has become ‘a monster that’s devouring us.’
